name: Patriarch's Desire
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/-2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Patrician's Scorn
text:
If you've cast another white spell this turn, you may cast Patrician's Scorn without paying its mana cost.
Destroy all enchantments.

editions.flavor: Lady Farisa's contempt of tawdry kitsch grew even more infamous after her death.

name: Patrol Hound
text: Discard a card: Patrol Hound gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: To the camp, it was a fierce and loyal protector. To the sentry's youngest daughter, it would always be her "Wuv Muffin."

name: Patrol Signaler
text: {1}{W}, {Q}: Create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: Many a keen-eared bogle has run afoul of a clever and silently orchestrated kithkin ambush.

name: Patron of the Akki
text:
Goblin offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Goblin and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Goblin. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever Patron of the Akki attacks, creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

name: Patron of the Kitsune
text:
Fox offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Fox and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Fox. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever a creature attacks, you may gain 1 life.

name: Patron of the Moon
text:
Moonfolk offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Moonfolk and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Moonfolk. Mana cost includes color.)
Flying
{1}: Put up to two land cards from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.

name: Patron of the Nezumi
text:
Rat offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Rat and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Rat. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever a permanent is put into an opponent's graveyard, that player loses 1 life.

name: Patron of the Orochi
text:
Snake offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Snake and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Snake. Mana cost includes color.)
{T}: Untap all Forests and all green creatures. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Patron of the Valiant
text:
Flying
When Patron of the Valiant enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: "Bant's most gallant knights wear my sigil, and for that I am humbled."

name: Patron of the Wild
text:
Morph {2}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Patron of the Wild is turned face up, target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Patron Wizard
text: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor: "The best way to teach is by example."

name: Pattern of Rebirth
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield. If that player does, he or she shuffles his or her library.

name: Paupers' Cage
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Paupers' Cage deals 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: A cage may keep you in, but it does not keep the stones out.

name: Pavel Maliki
text: {B}{R}: Pavel Maliki gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: We all know the legend: Pavel wanders the realms, helping those in greatest need. But is this a measure of his generosity, or of his obligation to atone?
We all know the legend: Pavel wanders the realms, helping those in greatest need. But is this a measure of his generosity, or of his obligation to atone?

name: Pawn of Ulamog
text: Whenever Pawn of Ulamog or another nontoken creature you control dies, you may create a 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

name: Pay No Heed
text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

editions.flavor: "My course is before me. There is nothing behind me."

"Out of this nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety."
—William Shakespeare, King Henry IV, Part I

"Inhale life. Exhale pain."
—Mystic elder

name: Peace and Quiet
text: Destroy two target enchantments.

editions.flavor:
"In time our realm will shine again. But it will gleam only when we scour away the taint of doubt."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Peacekeeper
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Peacekeeper unless you pay {1}{W}.
Creatures can't attack.

editions.flavor:
"I have always imagined my mother as such a woman, strong and wise."
—Sisay, journal

name: Peacekeeper Avatar
text: {3}: For each opponent who controls a creature, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a card named Arrest and attach it to a creature that player controls chosen at random.

editions.flavor: WL Participation Avatar

name: Peace of Mind
text: {W}, Discard a card: You gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"What can a peasant get for free that an emperor can never buy?"
—Dal riddle
Not all minds touched by the Eldrazi turn to raging psychosis. Some simply withdraw from this world into memories of a better one.

Three are the paths of the soul:
One out—roam across the plain,
One back—dwell with tribe and tent,
One in—turn an enemy's hate.

name: Peace Strider
text: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman

"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman

name: Peace Talks

"By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."

editions.flavor:

text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

Enchant creature

editions.flavor: Draped with the pennon of a fallen outpost, the sword came to symbolize the peoples of Zendikar becoming one.

—The Theriad

name: Pestilence Rats
text: Pestilence Rats's power is equal to the number of other Rats on the battlefield. (For example, as long as there are two other Rats on the battlefield, Pestilence Rats's power and toughness are 2/3.)

name: Pestilent Souleater
text: {B/P}: Pestilent Souleater gains infect until end of turn. ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life. A creature with infect deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

name: Petalmane Baku
text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Petalmane Baku.
{1}, Remove X ki counters from Petalmane Baku: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool.
